name: Albergo Bernini

reviews.title: Quaint B&B, great location!
reviews.text: We booked directly with Albergo Bernini based on recommendations by Rick Steves. I don't know why the previous reviews are below average. We had a great stay there, and the owners were nothing but nice to us.

You have to remember that anywhere in Italy and Europe, hotel rooms are going to be small and not very luxurious. It is what it is, you are there to enjoy and be part of the culture. If you want luxury, go to a Marriott!
reviews.title: Shop around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid 115 Euros for a room for 4 people, but we had to use one of the 4 shared bathrooms in the B&B. Not my first choice, since I do like my privacy, but the private rooms with their own bathrooms were booked already. But, we couldn't pass up on the great location and price of this place. The view of the Duomo and beautiful city of Siena from the terrace is absolutely gorgeous.
reviews.title: Ealry flea market

reviews.text: Another recommendation based on my own experience, is to sign up for a wine-tasting tour in the Montepulciano/Montecino area. The owners had some brochures on tours you could take, but we decided to do it on our own. We rented a car and drove through wine country to do tastings, but were disappointed with what we found. They are not very tourist friendly, and it was hard to communicate since we didn't speak Italian. Many of these wineries are small, and are not what you would typically encounter in say Napa or Sonoma California.
reviews.title: A Gem in the Heart of Tuscany

reviews.text: We reviewed Rick Steve's and selected Albergo Bernini, great view, good location to walk from. After reading Rick Steve's review we were excited to have some friendly interaction with the owners but it was anything but... it almost seemed if we were imposing on him by renting our rooms. There were 5 in our family so we had two rooms. The rooms were ok, but the bathrooms were in fair condition and not always clean.
reviews.title: In the heart of Siena

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we walked into the Bernini and Mauro, the owner, introduced himself and shook our hands, we felt like we were staying with the family in Siena. Our room was large, comfortable, charming, and had everything we needed (no TV, but I had had enough Italien TV by that time). The bed was firm and the bathroom was quite serviceable, though the shower with no enclosure took some getting used to. The internet point was a big plus with me, and reasonably priced too. We loved the central location near St. Catherine's head and an easy walk to Il Campo, restaurants, sites, etc. We took our breakfast at Nanini bar near the Dominican church, with a stop at Bar Sport on the way into town. The breakfast at the Bernini was just too high priced for us. Great Osteria downstairs below the hotel and went to 2 others near the Campo that satisfied as well. Mauro finally pulled out his famous accordian on our last afternoon while we were in the room resting up, and I'll always remember how wonderfully he played. We loved Siena and the Bernini and recommend it to the discriminatling traveler.
reviews.title: A Home in Siena

reviews.text: Three of us stayed at this Hotel last week-- we had one of the apartments just down the street (one double, one pull out couch)-- 120E per night.
reviews.title: Just OK- Great location

likes.liked: — apartment had a small fridge and wine glasses/opener

reviews.text: The room was expensive for what it was-- very outdated, very thin walls, and a dark, smoky entryway-- but it served the purpose and was in a great location.
reviews.title: Charming and perfect for us

reviews.text: The water was often cold and while the room was made up in the second day, we weren't given enough towels and had to go ask for more.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.disliked: — The dark stairs, it is on a timer and you get used to it

reviews.title: Wholeheartedly recommend this quaint hotel
reviews.text: Bottom Line--- stay here if you need to, but try to find something a little better for the cost.

Mauro and his family run a superb bed & breakfast. My wife and I stayed in a nice room (queen bed) with attached facilities. Albergo Bernini's breakfast terrace has a tremendous view of Siena. We used Siena as a base to explore the greater region of Tuscany (San Gimignano, Montepulciano and Pienza). Highly recommend!
reviews.title: Great family run B & B
Great Little Hotel
reviews.text: We spent 3 days in Siena and this was a wonderful hotel. Our hosts were very friendly and even gave us a nice little accordian concert. They have a wonderful deck up on the roof, overlooking the city, where they served us breakfast. We brought our own wine and cheese up in the evening and they came right up with glasses for us. It was great.

We stayed at Albergo Bernini for 3 nights in September. We thought it was a good room for the price. A little street noise, but it quieted down after 11:00pm. I would recommend it for most travelers. Close to several good places for dinner, one in particular is... La Tellina on Via Delle Terme 52. We had the best meal and the best waiter, Amelio. I would highly praise his kindness and service, a rarity in Italian waiters :)
reviews.title: Good value for the Price
Loved the hotel and city!!!1
reviews.text: LL & JL

reviews.title: Lovely place !
reviews.text: i went to this hotel with my grandparents. there were the three of us so i think we got the biggest room. in my opinion we also got the best veiw in the entire hotel!!! it is run by a family and has an amazing atmosphere. while there we met a mother and daughter who were also staying in this hotel and we are all very good friends now. while there you dont even really feel like you are in a hotel. it feels more like an apartment or something. it is very homely.

I was skeptical after reading the mixed reviews here, but had few choices when we decided to add Siena to our itinerary late in the planning. My concerns disapaited when we arrived and were warmly greeted by Allesandro and his wife. They helped us with our questions and orientation and made us feel welcome. Sure the rooms are fairly basic but clean and comfortable, and the terrace is the place for taking a break at sunset and enjoying a sunny breakfast.
reviews.title: Good accomodations and great value

reviews.text: We found the much maligned bathrooms to be clean and NOT smelly during our short stay -maybe we just hit it at the right time (although my girlfriend noted it was steamed up when she took her shower later in the morning after other guests - and we used just one of the two bathrooms available)
reviews.title: Avoid this hotel
Disappointed in Siena
reviews.text: Overall a great value - fine for the price. I would stay here again.

reviews.title: Great location and homey feeling
reviews.text: It is moderately cheap for a reason. The hotel and rooms have not been updated or cleaned for years. Upon arriving (no prior notification), you are informed of a Midnight curfew and that they do not take credit cards. They will help with directions and give you a map but they want it back. They offer breakfast for a charge and have no Internet. The only positive was the view from the deck but you have to go through the family's dining room to get to it (and they are in there eating and surfing the Internet that you are not allowed to use!). We really liked Siena but I would avoid this hotel due to dirty and outdated conditions and lack of services.

While the price was very reasonable for Siena, the hotel offered few services/amenities. While clean, the sheets had holes in them and the decor was early student hostel. While in the middle of town, it was noisy and the walls seemed made of paper. Parking was very difficult since the hotel offered no availability/access. Overall I was disappointed esp after reading so many positive reviews & expecting a lot more.
reviews.title: Good value - good location

description: Our hotel is in the heart of Siena, with 10 nice rooms and a great view from our wonderful terrace that is 24 h open to all the guests.we have wireless connection, breakfast service, ceiling fun in all of the rooms and the staff is always glad to be at your services for all your problems.We will be very happy to welcome you in our house!
